ARABIC: قُلْ مَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِلَّا مَن شَآءَ أَن يَتَّخِذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Say: 'I do not ask you for any wage for it - only that anyone who wants to should make his way towards his Lord.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Tell them: "I do not ask any recompense of you for this other than (urging) whoever likes may take the way to his Lord."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Tell them, "I do not ask of you any recompense for this work: I only ask of the one, who will, to adopt the way of his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Tell them, "I ask no recompense for my preaching to you, except the fact that whoever wants should choose the way of God."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Proclaim, “I do not ask any fee from you for this, except that whoever wills may take the way to his Lord.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Say: "No reward do I ask of you for this, save that whosoever wills may take a path to his Lord."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Say: I do not ask you aught in return except that he who will, may take the way to his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Say: 'I do not ask of you a wage for this, except for him who wishes to take to his Lord a way.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Say: I ask of you no reward for this, save that whoso will may choose a way unto his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Say, "I do not ask you for any recompense for this except that anyone who so wishes should take the right path to his Lord."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Say thou. ask of you no hire for this, save that whosoever will may take unto his Lord a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Say, ‘I do not ask you any reward for it, except that anyone who wishes should take the way to his Lord.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Say: "No reward do I ask of you for it but this: that each one who will may take a (straight) Path to his Lord."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Say: "No reward do I ask of you for this (that which I have brought from my Lord and its preaching, etc.), save that whosoever wills, may take a Path to his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Say: 'I demand of you no wage for this except for he who wishes to take the Path to his Lord'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Say, “I ask of you no payment for this—only that whoever wills may take a path to his Lord.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Say, "I do not ask of you for it any payment - only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [25:57] Say: ‘I do not ask of you in return for this, that is, for delivering that [Message] with which I have been sent, any reward, except that whoever wishes to follow a way to his Lord [should do so]’, by expending his wealth for the sake of [attaining] God’s pleasure, exalted be He; then [whoever wishes to do so] I will not prevent him from doing so.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Say) Muhammad to the people of Mecca: (I ask of you no reward) no payment or provision (for this) for professing Allah's divine Oneness and for the Qur'an, (save that whoso will may choose a way unto his Lord) through faith; it is also said that this means: save for the one who desires to profess Allah's divine Oneness and by means of this profession tread a way back to his Lord whereby he will find his reward.
